Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with traces of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; below, two white bands; exterior reserved save trace of elaborate rosette at left; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the scant decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169). The number 22 is written in pencil and crossed out on the exterior of the left hand sherd; the number 35 is written in pencil on the exterior of the right hand sherd. The number 35 is also written on a label on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 20.11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1487) (phase 2)
